description: Perhaps related to snite (verb), or perhaps related to gnast.

entries.meaning: (obsolete, dialectal) The burnt or burning part of the wick of a candle; the snuff.
examples: Till some part of the candle was consumed, and the dust gathered about the snaste; but then it made the snaste big, and long, and to burn duskishly.

verbs.description: snaste (third-person singular simple present snastes, present participle snasting, simple past and past participle snasted)

entries.meaning: (transitive, obsolete, dialectal) To snuff a candle.
